description: Excavation and extension of basement including creation of front light well and front basement extension under entranceway; and erection of single-storey rear and side extensions at ground floor level.
decision_conditions: <p>Details of a green roof, designed for biodiversity and as part of a sustainable urban drainage system, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing before any work on the site is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of enhancing biodiversity and managing flood risk and providing a sustainable drainage system.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable urban drainage.</p>

Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before any work on the relevant part is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.


a) 1:20 elevations of the windows in the front lightwell.

b) Materials details of the front lightwell and windows.    

c) 1:50 elevations of the proposed door within the front elevation of the side extension. 


REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
